summary: Frontend-only social media website for artists named Artlink, matching a provided reference UI, with all buttons and UI interactions working on the client side.
architectural_notes: UI should closely replicate a provided reference design.
known_issues: Reference UI asset (screenshot/link) is not included in the conversation transcript; required to match design accurately.

existing_features.title: Recreate the Artlink UI to closely match the provided reference image (layout, spacing, typography, colors, component shapes), including: (1) Login screen (split card with artwork on left + login form on right), (2) Home feed screen with left sidebar navigation and community list, top search bar, stories row, main post feed, and right-side 'Suggested for you' panel, and (3) Explore screen with the same global layout and a content grid with category/filter chips.

Implement client-side routing/navigation so all primary sidebar items and key UI controls navigate to the correct screens: Home, Explore, Create, Profile, and Communities (community detail view). Use placeholder/mock screens for any sections not fully defined by the reference image, but keep the global layout consistent.

Make all visible buttons and interactive UI elements perform meaningful client-side actions (no backend): login form validation + 'Login' submits to enter the app, 'Forgot password' and 'Signup' open appropriate client-side flows (modal or route), follow buttons toggle state, like/comment/share on posts update UI state, story items are clickable, search input filters mock content, and notification/message/profile icons open dropdowns or panels.

Create a small mock data layer for users, posts, communities, stories, and explore tiles, and persist key UI state in localStorage (e.g., mock logged-in user, follows, likes, and last selected route/filter) so interactions remain after refresh.

Add the required generated static image assets (login illustration/background accents, placeholder avatars, and placeholder artwork/media tiles) into frontend/public/assets/generated and wire them into the UI so the screens resemble the reference image without broken images.

Adjust the Home page feed layout so the first post card appears closer to the Stories row (reduce the vertical spacing/margins that push the posts too far down), while keeping the overall Home layout (stories, post feed, right-side suggestions) intact.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build Artlink (artist-focused social media) frontend to match the provided reference UI closely.
Implement working client-side UI interactions for all buttons/controls (frontend-only; no backend required).
Adjust Home feed layout so the post feed is positioned higher, closer to the Stories section (reduce vertical spacing/margins pushing posts down).
